conclusion: Identify the given data and understand the process for states A, B, and C.
From the p-V diagram, pressure remains constant as volume increases from B to C.
Determine the process from B to C is isobaric.
For an isobaric process, work done W is given by W = P ΔV.
Calculate the change in volume ΔV = V_C - V_B.
Substitute values into the work formula to find W = 200 J.
Determine the sign of the work done; since volume increases, work is positive.
